Just the first sentence alone here from Stepanie Yee and Tony Chu is solid:
In machine learning, computers apply¬†statistical learning¬†techniques to automatically identify patterns in data. These techniques can be used to make highly accurate predictions.




And what ‚Ä¶
articles.title: A visual introduction to machine learning

articles.author: Jenn Lukas
articles.description:
What‚Äôs one thing we can do to make our site better? Maybe nothing at all!
Our websites keep getting bigger and bigger! When we have a team with so many exciting ideas and such interesting technology, it can be easy ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Maybe Nothing

articles.author: Chris Coyier
articles.description:
Huh! I did not realize that CSS custom properties had their own resolution behavior for how !important works in their values. Uh, despite writing a guide about them. üò¨ But hey it‚Äôs now updated.
Stefan Judis documents it clearly. ‚Ä¶
articles.title: The surprising behavior of !important in CSS custom property values

articles.author: Andy Bell
articles.description: When Chris first sent me this prompt, I was thinking about writing about progressive enhancement, but that subject is so wide-reaching to be one thing and all too predictable, especially for those already familiar with my writing. Saying that, what ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Consistent, Fluidly Scaling Type and Spacing

articles.author: Chris Coyier
articles.description: Jordan Scales explores the computer science concept of topological sorting, and what it might look like if applied to the concept of  z-index in CSS. So, you don‚Äôt express what the z-index should be directly; instead, you say exactly ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Topological sort

articles.author: Chris Coyier
articles.description: Three cheers for (draft stage) progress on a Sanitizer API! It‚Äôs gospel that you can‚Äôt trust user input. And indeed, any app I‚Äôve ever worked on has dealt with bad actors trying to slip in and execute nefarious code ‚Ä¶
articles.title: HTML Sanitizer API

articles.author: Farai Gandiya
articles.description: Between Google Chrome experimenting with ‚Äúfollowing‚Äù sites, along with a growing frustration of how social media platforms limit a creator‚Äôs reach to their fans through algorithmic feeds, there‚Äôs been renewed interest in RSS feeds and they‚Äôre primed for a ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Working With Web Feeds: It‚Äôs More Than RSS

articles.author: Chris Coyier
articles.description: I was reading Jake‚Äôs ‚ÄúCross-fading any two DOM elements is currently impossible‚Äù which is a wonderfully nerdy deep dive into how there is no real way to literally cross-fade elements. Yeah, you can animate both of their opacities, but even ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Maybe there kinda is background-opacity?

articles.author: Chris Coyier
articles.description: Matias Capeletto covers the breadth of Vite, from the technological shoulders it stands on, to the peers exploring similar territory, to the other technologies it supports, to the frameworks that now use it primarily, and more. The fact that ‚Ä¶
articles.title: The Vite Ecosystem

articles.author: Laura Kalbag
articles.description: Earlier this week, I tried out a starter theme for a blog platform. The theme had loads of nice default features: pretty typography, fancy navigation, dark mode widget‚Ä¶ and a couple of default trackers I really don‚Äôt want just sitting ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Remove Trackers

articles.author: Chris Coyier
articles.description:
Google is handing out bucks for CSS-related projects, so you might as well know about it! Nicole Sullivan:
All of us who work on the web regularly benefit from the work of people who create specifications, tools, demos, tutorials, and 
‚Ä¶
articles.title: The UI fund

No worries, this ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Read Your Website

articles.description:
Ain‚Äôt this the truth:
It‚Äôs like when you‚Äôre learning a new language. At some point your brain goes from¬†translating¬†from your mother tongue into the other language, and instead starts¬†thinking¬†in that other language.




I don‚Äôt speak ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Faulty logic

articles.author: Amit Sheen
articles.description: What‚Äôs the one thing people can do to make their website better? Now that is a good question. One with many right answers, like improving performance, taking care of accessibility, and upgrading user experience as prime examples. These are all ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Think Without Boxes

articles.author: Chris Coyier
articles.description:
(This is a sponsored post.)
I got this question from a listener the other day. Fair question, I‚Äôd say. The word ‚ÄúStatic‚Äù in ‚ÄúStatic Site Generator‚Äù is at-odds with the word ‚ÄúDynamic.‚Äù It seems to imply that the website ‚Ä¶
articles.title: I‚Äôm confused about Static Site Generators. Are they only for informational sites where I can‚Äôt log in or display any dynamic data?

sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine ‚Äî For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nick Babich & Gleb Kuznetsov)
articles.description: Modern HMIs are transforming the way we interact with our vehicles. A car becomes a gadget that we use in a similar way as we use our phones. Users expect a lot of HMI, they even evaluate car experience based on the experience they have with HMI. In this article, let‚Äôs look at some ways to help us satisfy users‚Äô needs with proper design.
articles.title: Designing Human-Machine Interfaces For Vehicles Of The Future

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nwani Victory)
articles.description: In every software-as-a-service solution, user billing and payments are key aspects in the sale of services rendered. Let‚Äôs learn about Stripe and how the REST API can be programmatically used in serverless functions to manage the billing for an application.
articles.title: Billing Management For Your Next SaaS Idea Using Stripe And Azure Functions

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Steven Hoober)
articles.description: Before we can talk about how people interact, much less how to take advantage of that knowledge and design, it‚Äôs important to understand a bit about the history, the technology, and what today counts as a mobile touchscreen device at all.
articles.title: Touch Design For Mobile Interfaces: Defining Mobile Devices (Excerpt)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nafees Nehar)
articles.description: To be able to modify headers in a testing environment is a great thing to have. It allows control over your application as one can bypass authentication, set cookies, and so on. In this article, Nafees Nehar explores some methods which allow modification of headers in an automation testing setup.
articles.title: Modifying Headers In HTTP(s) Requests In UI Automation Testing
